listitem.para: statistical confidence level (%) as a string or the level of significance (alpha) as a decimal value, "95%", "99%", "99.9%" or 0.05, 0.01, 0.001 resp (see examples).

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Performs the basic Dean-Dixon outlier test. It sorts the distribution in ascending or descending order, then takes the minimum and maximum values (xi) and calculates the respective Q value for both xi values. This is compared with the critical value from a table (Qcrit). If one of the two or both Q values greater than the corresponding Qcrit value, one orboth xi values are outliers.
Only one outlier can be found on each side.

important.para: Do use ST_deandixon ONLY with NORMAL distributed data and with more than 3 and less than 30 values! For more than 30 values use Pearson-Hartley test ""ST_pearsonhartley()"" instead.

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting: data = [6 8 14 12 35 15]; of = ST_deandixon(data, "95%") // outlier-free values [of, o] = ST_deandixon(data, "95%") // outlier and outlier-free values [of, o] = ST_deandixon(data, 0.05) // outlier and outlier-free values
